column1: The problem thus proposed may be solved by means of electricity. Take a goblet like the one that supports the pipe
column2: and rub it briskly against your coat sleeve
column3: so as to electrify the glass through friction. Having done this
column4: bring the goblet to within about a centimeter of the pipe stem. The latter will then be seen to be strongly attracted
column5: and will follow the glass around and finally fall from its support. This curious experiment is a pretty variation of the electric pendulum; and it shows that pipe-clay--a very bad conductor of electricity--favors very well the attraction of an electrified body. Tumblers or goblets are to be found in every house
column6: and a clay pipe is easily procured anywhere. So it would be difficult to produce manifestations of electricity more easily and at less expense than by the means here described.
